alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Broadwater and west central Meagher Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles north of Townsend, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Logan On The Smith River and Fort Logan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm should remain just north of the Woods Creek Burn scar, but burn scar flooding may be possible if the storm shifts southward. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and southwestern Montana.
